commit.message:
Preferences: drop restoreLastSong|Playlist

	* Removed
		- Preferences options `restoreLastSong` and `restoreLastPlaylist` were
			dropped. Instead, both will always be restored automatically. In order to
			start with a blank song/playlist, load a new one before quitting.
AppVeyor: install jack before pacman refresh
AppVeyor: job dependent Win package prefix

Update INSTALL.md

Elaborate and simplify section on missing shared libraries after manual compilation

AE: tweak debug log levels

there are still quite a number of commented log messages within the `AudioEngine` class. They are key for debugging stuff changed for the 1.2.0 version and save a lot of time. However, things seem to be more and more stable and I had not used them in months.

Previously, they had all sorts of log levels including debug, info, and warning in order to better read the resulting log due to the different colors associated to each level. Those all have been set to debug now as they are definitely debug level and in order to not confuse new developers.

AE: add drivers to log messages

since I tweaked the issue template and it is asking the user to attach a log as well as provided a description in the Wiki, we have a lot more error logs in new issues. Which is definitely good.

Still, they could be more expressive.

With this patch the audio and MIDI drivers used are added to all log messages of the AudioEngine. This might help to interpret the logs and spot errors more easily
ChangeLog: add dotted SE grid lines

commit.message:
Render song editor background grid with dotted lines.

This makes it easier to see the active cells and song structure,
and should be easier on the eyes, reducing "grid illusions".

commit.message: Merge branch 'master' into cme-audio-perf
ChamgeLog: add missing include fix
Assume conflicting "gettext-runtime" is installed when installing qt that depends on it
Fix missing include

Faster master peak detection

Enable faster master peak detection by removing potentially-aliasing
update of m_fMasterPeak_[LR] in loop.
Avoid gettimeofday() calls for LADSPA timing when not enabled

Short-circuit sampler mixing when inactive

The sampler is (almost?) never used, but previously the output was
unconditionally mixed into the audio output. Short-circuiting the
sampler when no notes are active allows this and the ssociated
memsets to be skipped.
Merge branch 'master' into cme-audio-perf
Merge commit '485007d3e5fff80b01ed7240a8f4a70569397ab1' into cme-audio-perf

AE: restrict JACK patch

to be only active when the JACK driver is actually used.

I was a little too confident in here and it uncovered other bugs in production

PortAudio: fix buzzing sound during startup (#1932)

The buffers of Port Audio driver were not reset after initialization. With the lastest JACK patch in place this caused the arbitrary buffer content to be played back during startup until the Audio Engine was ready.
DiskWriterDriver: NULL -> nullptr
ChangeLog: add DPD empty notes fix

DPE: guard against empty instrument notes

in case the drumkit of the song can not be found the notes in the pattern might correspond to an empty instrument / have an ID of `-1`
AppStream: add 1.2.3 release metadata

AudioEngine: no process while not ready

probably due to some upstream JACK bugs (not sure) Hydrogen does occassionally segfault when stopping the `JackAudioDriver`. Turns out JACK has a number of issues with thread joining. During teardown of the driver we must ensure it does not do any communication, like locking the `AudioEngine` or enqueuing a message in our `Logger`. Otherwise the thread calling `jack_client_close` might segfault.

Now, the callback of the `AudioEngine` checks its state twice. Once without locking (in order to `return` when it is not ready yet/anymore) and another time while locked to properly check the state. It is a little dirty. But I do not see what else we can do from within the Hydrogen code base

tests/jackTearDown: increase startup time

to prevent false positives occurring in case the OSC QUIT message gets send before Hydrogen has properly started up

tests: fix integration test

jackTearDown integration test can now handle crashes of Hydrogen and shows - thanks to our crash reporter - the stack trace

tests: add integration tests

to reproduce crash on teardown when using JACK as audio driver.

Test is not done yet. It works properly on non-zero exit codes but not on crashes (which is what we encounter here)
